section.name: Using The API
section.p: The FileSystemManager interface provides access to Commons VFS. Using this interface you can locate files and create file systems. There are a number of ways to obtain a FileSystemManager instance:

ul.li: Use the static VFS.getManager() method, which returns the default Commons VFS implementation.

Create an instance of DefaultFileSystemManager and configure it manually. DefaultFileSystemManager does not include any providers or other services. You will have to add these to make it do anything useful.

Create an instance of StandardFileSystemManager, a useful subclass of DefaultFileSystemManager that includes all the standard providers and services. You can add extra providers, or replace the standard providers with custom implementations.

section.p: Once you have a FileSystemManager, you can use one of its resolveFile() methods to locate a file by name. For example:
section.source: FileSystemManager fsManager = VFS.getManager(); FileObject aJarFile = fsManager.resolveFile( "jar:lib/aJarFile.jar" );
